pageContext.description: Of the usual circular socketed type.
pageContext.associations: G. Sword and small lugged Chisel.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Jo. VII, 195 (1850),Evans, "Anc. Br. Imps", 168, 174, 466,Breden, Vic. Co. Hist. Shrops. I, 202

pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Parish of Selattyn,Oswestry (near?),Proved by a label gummed on it "From Mr. Ormsby Gore, 1864," to be the missing gouge from Brogyntyn. This gouge is reported as being found with tanged chisel, which in turn seems to be part of the "Oswestry Bronzes" Hoard. See Lord Harlech's Collection, No. 2
